<BoundingBox CRS="CRS:84" minx="-73.432176" miny="41.129317" maxx="-67.356526" maxy="46.779327"/> <BoundingBox CRS="EPSG:4326" minx="41.129317" miny="-73.432176" maxx="46.779327" maxy="-67.356526"/> <BoundingBox CRS="EPSG:3785" minx="-8174432.438900" miny="5031434.574100" maxx="-7498094.192500" maxy="5906128.791500"/>       <Layer queryable="1">         <Name>4</Name>         <Title><![CDATA[NPL Site Boundary]]></Title>         <Abstract><![CDATA[These data were developed to identify Superfund sites included in the National Priority List (NPL). Sites are listed on the National Priorities List upon completion of Hazard Ranking System (HRS) screening, public solicitation of comments about the proposed site, and after all comments have been addressed. The identification of a site for the NPL is intended primarily to guide EPA in: determining which sites warrant further investigation to assess the nature and extent of the human health and environmental risks associated with a site; identifying what CERCLA-financed remedial actions may be appropriate; notifying the public of sites EPA believes warrant further investigation; and serving notice to potentially responsible parties that EPA may initiate CERCLA-financed remedial action. Inclusion of a site on the NPL does not in itself reflect a judgment of the activities of its owner or operator, it does not require those persons to undertake any action, nor does it assign liability to any person. The NPL serves primarily informational purposes, identifying for the States and the public those sites or other releases that appear to warrant remedial actions.GIS staff worked with individual site project managers to delineate site boundaries. ]]></Abstract> <CRS>CRS:84</CRS> <CRS>EPSG:4326</CRS> <CRS>EPSG:3785</CRS>  <!-- alias 3785 --> <CRS>EPSG:102113</CRS>
